intro: Erigeron antonius, commonly known as the "Antonius' fleabane," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing a showy display of white to pale blue petals. Erigeron antonius is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and coastal areas.
